name: syncthing
description: Syncthing is a peer-to-peer file synchronization tool that securely syncs folders across devices without a central server, using a web UI and background service.
features: Peer-to-peer sync: Synchronizes files directly between devices without central server.
Selective sync: Chooses which folders to sync on each device for storage management.
Conflict resolution: Handles file conflicts with versioning and conflict copies.
Encrypted transfer: Protects data in transit with TLS encryption between devices.
File versioning: Keeps historical versions of files with configurable retention policies.
Ignore patterns: Excludes files and folders from sync using .stignore files.
Relay support: Connects devices behind NAT or firewalls using relay servers.
Discovery methods: Finds devices via local discovery, global discovery, or static addresses.
Bandwidth control: Limits upload and download speeds to manage network usage.
Web interface: Manages sync configuration through built-in web UI.
Cross-platform: Runs on Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, and BSD systems.
Folder sharing: Shares folders with specific devices using unique folder IDs.
